Transportation Expenses as Reimbursable Expenses
The expenses incurred for transporting the body of a deceased Veteran or other beneficiary to the place of burial and for an attendant or escort to and from the place of burial are payable as reimbursement from accrued benefits without regard to the restrictions stated in
38 CFR 3.1706
and
38 CFR 3.1709
as to hospitalization by VA or shipment by Government bill of lading.
If the expenses of transporting the body of a deceased Veteran were partially paid by VA in connection with a burial claim, only those expenses in excess of the amount paid by VA will be reimbursed.
